page.title: 18The Woodbridge Inn
page.content: The Woodbridge Public House stands by the Coalport Bridge on the southern bank of the river .It is open every day of the year 11.00am until 3.00pm and again from 6.00pm until 11.00pm The busiest days are Friday and Saturdays when the car park is full to over-flowing . There are two bars,a small restaurant and a children's room.In good weather people can sit on benches and grass by the river and there is a play area for children. The pub serves beers ,lagers and spirits as well as soft drinks like Coke, lemonade and Vimto.You can buy a full meal, snacks or sweets.You can also stay bed and breakfast at the pub The building spans 300 years and gets its name from an old wooden bridge that once stood by it.The present iron bridge was built in 1818.
